author: {'steamid': '76561198035144166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2115, 'last_played': 1540350408}
review:
TL;DR: It's A-OK. 7.0 / 10. Get it during a discount.

---
Short Version:

The good:

+ Yet another new take on the Neptunia series, experimenting with new gameplay.
+ A decent cast of characters, 90% of which are newcomers.
+ A LOT of game time to be had with this one.
+ Lots of character interaction.
+ A-OK humor, saved by a few nice references here and there. Not the worst entry.

The meh:

= The self insert male character. A bit out of place.
= Level design is a-ok. Not great, not disastrous.
= Storytelling is just fine.
= Odd chibi. Not awful, but not exactly masterpiece level either.
= A-OK DLC. The characters (Tiara) really save that one.
= A different, personality shifted Noire. Not as bad as you might think. Not great either though.

The bad:

- HORRID balancing, on all sides.
- Probably the most tedious Lily grind in the entire series.
- ABYSMAL and utterly lazy music mixing.
- Doesn't play nice with nVidea GPUs and V-Sync.

---
Long Version:

The good:

+ IF and Compile Heart keep seeking out new ways to inject some love and some novelty into the Neptunia series. This time around, it's a tactics game. Really reminded me of Onimusha Tactics for the Game Boy Advanced back in the day, except more complex and with better waifus, if you're into that sort of thing. For a developer which isn't familiar with the genre, the effort is commendable, despite it not being flawless by a huge margin.

+ The new characters, referred to as Generals. Those are references to games and most have personality quirks which make sense if you did play those games. Some more than others, some less. Lots of new faces, new voice actors, new dynamics and new chemistry.

+ There are quite a few main missions, quite a few side missions, quite a few farm missions, side activities and talk breaks you'll be able to enjoy. There are no minigames this time around, but you do get a sort of "quizz" game which might be obscure for an english speaker.

+ Quite a few visual novel breaks. A few good hours of character interaction. Aside from DLC characters, every character interacts with every other one in some shape of form. Every character has a specific chemistry with another one. Personalities are defined and there's no Plutia Sue syndrome in sight.

+ Neptune isn't happy not being the lead character and that does play out nicely. She's not the only one making those meta references anymore, but that's done finely enough not to be annoying. The various references to games, some moments of "SAW THAT COMING!" and just the right amount of "good" cringe.

The meh:

= Lotsa people aren't happy with the self insert character. It's not as bad as one might think, but it's not very well fleshed out either. Then again, a male self-insert character within the Neptunia multiverse was bound to be awkward. Opinions are divided on this one. For me, it's neither a good nor a bad thing. It's just there.

= Level design allows for a lot of variety for the player, but is utterly ignored by the AI. 99% of traps only affer the player and as such, you can't use the new Turn Based Tactics gamepley to the fullest of it's potential. You can't trap enemies, you can't exploit the terrain to your advantages. But the enemy can, which leads to balancing issues.

= Story-telling is alright. It's not one of those shock-and-awe moments like Mk2 had. It's not one of those epic sagas like V-II had. But it's not an utter was like Victory either. It's there, it's a Neptunia storyline, it's decent without being stellar by any means.

= The new chibi art style is an acquired taste. I was skeptical on it at first and still am. It's not ugly or off-puting, but it's not exactly appealing either. Just ... Odd.

= The DLC is a mixed bag for the most part. The weapons/gear ones help counter the utterly broken balancing, while the DLC characters (particularly Compa and Tiara) allow for some interesting switcharounds in your party. Overall, it's not worth mentioning in a good or bad light. Just like the chibi art and self-insert character, it's kinda there and that's about it.

= This is not the Hyperdimension, Megadimension or Ultradimension Noire we're dealing with here. She's a mixed bag. She does come off as a Plutia Sue in a couple moments but does get served for it. She's not exactly a loner anymore and her relaitonship with the self-insert feels a bit forced and un-natural. Overall, it's not THE Noire. But it's A Noire, that's for sure.

The bad:

- Balancing. THE worst part of this game. Very awkward damage system, broken levels (on both sides) and utterly DESTROYED bossess starting with Chapter 7. Bosses and enemies are all over the place, some being utterly weak and unable to fight tissue paper, some being able to singlehandedly ROFLSTOMP your entire party while being 10 levels below you. Level design is one sided. Some of your party members are going to be useless, some are going to be a powerhouse. Noire, Neptune and Blanc overlap a lot. Balancing is simply non-existent, if not downright infuriating at some points.

- THE worst Lily Rank grind in the entire series, period.

- BROKEN music. While the tracks themselves are re-used neptunia tracks, which is just fine by me because neptunia music is actually good, the way they're mixed is retarded. The songs cut off in the middle of a note and just restart. Always. Everywhere. Even in sound test. Laziest sound editor, ever.

- As usual, this game does NOT like my GTX 1050 Ti card. The only way to be able to launch the game at all is to kill V-Sync in nVidea control panel, otherwise the game won't even start... Not surprised, tbh, as this is a running theme with Neptunia games. But someday, sometime, whoever's writing the GFX part of the series needs to learn how to write a damn patch for 60 FPS + V-Sync. For real.



Conclusion:

Hyperdevotion seems to be a testing ground for IF/Compile Heart to explore new territory, and it shows. A lot of the game is unpolished, if not downright lazy/broken. The parts which IF/Compa are experienced with are still good, the visual novel, the variety, the characters, the nep. But the parts which they tried for the first time, well, you can feel they're not used to it: The gameplay, the mediocre AI, the onesided level design, the non-existent balancing ...

Overall, HyperDevotion is okay. It's not excellent by any means, but it's not a complete disaster either. If you're a fan of the series, then it's worth checking out. Otherwise, don't bother buying this game at full price. It's not a great turn based tactics game. Just an a-ok one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163746886', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 4425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3619, 'last_played': 1535574573}
review:
Hyperdevotion Noire es un maravilloso juego JRPG del estilo SRPG (estrategia por casillas al mÃ¡s puro estilo Fire Emblem o FF Tactics) teniendo carisma propio con unos muy buenos diseÃ±os de escenarios, variedad de zonas de combate, dificultad mÃ¡s que decente en nivel normal (incluye tambiÃ©n dificil para los que quieran un buen reto), y contanto tanto con ideas tipicas del gÃ©nero SRPG como con ideas nuevas, teniendo una gran cantidad de personajes para usar en combate de distintas maneras, cada una de las generales del juego completamente distinta a la anterior y el impresionante poder de las diosas protagonistas de la franquicia con sus transformaciones HDD que hacen aumentan su increible poder por 3 turnos que usados estrategicamente puede darte la victoria en el combate.

muy sorprendido con el resultado de este juego, me encanta la franquicia de Neptunia pero no pensÃ© que este juego tendrÃ­a una muy buena calidad, sin mencionar que lo comprÃ© a solo 3$ en ofertas y sumando un DLC que pillÃ© serÃ­an 4$ por un juego que me ha durado 65 horas totales incluso viendo el final verdadero y aÃºn asÃ­ quedando muchos logros pendientes, aquellos amantes de conseguir todos los logros tendrÃ¡n un juego de casi 100hrs incluso para hacer su 100% y al precio que lo comprÃ© definitivamente es un juego que sientes haber robado a la empresa por pagar tan poco por tanto

en un PC de bajas especificaciones funciona perfectamente bien, solo una vez se me saliÃ³ inesperadamente sin razÃ³n alguna pero luego de eso no e tenido ningÃºn fallo en el juego, destacando y alabando a Compile Heart e Idea Factory por la compatibilidad tan maravillosa con mandos gÃ©nericos, simplemente conectÃ© mi mando gÃ©nerico de PS3/PC y ya estÃ¡, perfectamente reconocido como si de un mando de x360 se tratase, algo que muchos mÃ¡s juegos de los que puedan parecer no son capaces de hacer bien dando grandes dolores de cabeza a aquellos que no cuentan con mandos oficiales de 360/one/ps4/switch.

lÃ³gicamente no hablarÃ© de la historia ya que como suele pasar en la franquicia, la historia no es nada del otro mundo, centrado mÃ¡s en su comedia y referencias al mundo de los videojuegos, pero en resumen, un juego super entretenido, largo, con decente dificultad y que para aficionados a los SRPG/JRPG o seguidores de la saga neptunia es un titulo super recomendado que te darÃ¡ mucha duraciÃ³n, con un excelente port que de seguro en cualquier PC servirÃ¡ sin problemas

Nota: 8.5/10 muy recomendado (aunque advierto que si no soportas el Moe, clichÃ© o las waifus por todos lados mejor ni lo toques)

author: {'steamid': '76561198069159152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2420, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1533804252}
review:
This is a cute alternate world to the main Neptunia games (which appear to consist of the Re;Birth trilogy and Megadimension). In this world, called Gamarket, Noire is the most powerful of the CPUs, proving it by beating the other three by herself. And then... something happens stripping all of them of their Shares. From there, they have to work together to save the world.

Characters are engaging, plot is intriguing, battles are exciting... oh, and much of the game is chibi-fied!

Wholy recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012637374', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1572, 'last_played': 1596738456}
review: I've played a decent ammount of hours in the game, and i am no where near done. I really enjoy the time i'm having when leaning back and playing this game. With that said, everything you read in these "reviews" about Crashing, Alt tabbing + opening it back up, Right clicking on a monster, all causes the Game to crash or be unplayable. There is no support to be gathered from the Game Company. You might ask yourself if it's worth picking up then, when the game itself is super entertaining and fun to play, when it deside to work, and what i will recommend is trying it out. Feel free to try using the Steam 3 hour refund policy if the game end up being unplayable for you. Would also recommend a Controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054216330', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 6064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6034, 'last_played': 1530170267}
review:
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

Gameplaytechnisch unterscheidet sich "Hyperdevotion Noire: Goddess Black Heart" sehr von der Originalreihe.
Das [b]Kampfsystem[/b] ist ein relativ einfaches TaktikKS. Man bewegt seine Spielfiguren Ã¼ber ein auf viereckigen Feldern basierendes Spielfeld, das mit unterschiedlichen Gimmiks aufwarten kann, wie etwa Bodenfallen, die dem Charakter, der darauf tritt nicht nur Schaden zufÃ¼gen, sondern seinen Zug auch instant beenden. 
Jeder Charakter hat unterschiedliche [b]FÃ¤higkeiten[/b], die er wie in RPGs Ã¼blich durch Level UPs freischaltet sowie auch spezielle Talente wie schweben oder eine besonders weite Zugreichweite, SprunghÃ¶he oder Wurfweite, die ebenfalls entscheidend sind. 
Fahigkeiten haben zudem unterschiedliche Wirkungsbereicheund kÃ¶nnen offensiver oder deffensiver Natur sein. Erfahrung erhalten Charaktere je nach Level bzw StÃ¤rkeunterschied zwischen ihnen und ihrem Ziel.
Neben einander stehende Charaktere bekommen einen [b]UnterstÃ¼zungsbonus[/b] fÃ¼r ihre FÃ¤higkeiten, durch den FÃ¤higkeiten weniger Mana kosten und auch stÃ¤rker werden. Hierdurch wird obendrein der Lilirang (Freundschaftswert) beider Charaktere gesteigert. Je hÃ¶her der Lilirang, desto grÃ¶ÃŸer der Bonus. Mehr Charaktere, die um den ausfÃ¼hrenden Charakter herumstehen, erhÃ¶hen den Bonus noch weiter.

Ein Gameplayelement, das wohl im kompletten Neptuniauntiversum zu finden ist, ist das [b]Craftingsystem[/b], mit dem aus
dem Loot besiegter Feinde, nÃ¼tzliche Items wie HeiltrÃ¤nke oder Waffen hergestellt werden kÃ¶nnen, die ab da im Laden gegen Credits verfÃ¼gbar sind. 

Ein anderes Gameplayelement ist [b]Sim Noire[/b], wo man gemeinsam mit der Protagonistin Anfragen aus der BevÃ¶lkerung bearbeitet, indem man eine der drei mÃ¶glichen Antworten wÃ¤hlt. Liegt man oft genug richtig (ist einer Meinung mit Noire), gibt es eine kleine Belohnung in Form von items und einer Cutscene. 
Hart erkÃ¤mpftes Geld kann wie in RPGs Ã¼blich im Shop fÃ¼r Items ausgegeben werden, allerdings bekommt man hier fÃ¼r 10 ausgegebene Credits 1 Sim Punkt. Diese Punkte kann man in Inneneinrichtung investieren, um NoireÂ´s PrivatrÃ¤ume wohnlicher zu machen. Gameplaytechnisch hat das allerdings keinen Einfluss.

Ein negativpunkt ist, dass das Spiel im Vollbildmodus gern mal abstÃ¼rzt, was einen im Zweifelsfall mal mehrere Missionen zurÃ¼ckwerfen kann, wenn man vergessen hat, zu speichern. FÃ¼r diese und andere EventualitÃ¤ten gibt es die Autospeicherfunktion, die wÃ¤hrend laufender KÃ¤mpfe genutzt werden kann.
Sollte ein Kampf dennoch zu schwer sein, gibt es die MÃ¶glichkeit, diesen nach der niederlage mit verringerter Schwierigkit zu wiederholen.

[h1]Grafik, Soundtrack[/h1]

Die Grafik im Kampfsystem basiert hier anders als fÃ¼r Neptuniagames Ã¼blich auf Chibicharakteren mit groÃŸen KÃ¶pfen
(Charaktere). Zwischensequenzen sind wie gewohnt im Animestil gehalten.
Der Soundtrack orientiert sich teils an klassichen StÃ¼cken aus dem OST Ã¤lterer Neptuniagames, hat aber viel neues dabei.

[h1]Zusammenfassung[/h1]

[b]Pro[/b]
[list]
    [*]verschiedene Schwierigkeitsgrade
    [*]wiederholbare Missionen
    [*]taktisch tiefgÃ¤ngige KÃ¤mpfe
    [*]im Falle eines Game Over kann die mission auf einem geringeren Schwierigkeitsgrad wiederholt werden
[/list]
[b]Kontra[/b]
[list]
    [*]Spiel kann unter UmstÃ¤nden Ã¶fter mal abstÃ¼rzen
    [*]Schwierigkeitsgrad im laufenden Spiel nicht mehr Ã¤nderbar
    [*]Fallen am Boden zÃ¤hlen nicht fÃ¼r Gegner und haben im SpÃ¤teren Verlauf kaum wirklichen Mehrwert
[/list]

[b]Fazit[/b]
"Hyperdevotion Noire: Goddess Black Heart" richtet sich an Fans der Titelheldin und der Originalreihe, die gern auch ein Mal ein Strategiespiel in die Hand nehmen. Wer hier eine tiefgÃ¤ngige, ernste Handlung sucht, sucht besser weiter. Es gibt zwar auch ernstere Momente, aber all zu lange dauern diese nie an.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018580644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1560624403}
review:
Everyone complains about constant crashes and it's true. Unplayable.

Additionally, after a Windows 10 update (or some other unknown cause) the game doesn't even get past the first loading screen before crashing, every time. 

0/10 for game support. No help from Idea Factory.

author: {'steamid': '76561198240172128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1527335943}
review:
The gameplay feels much simpler than the main entries in the series, which makes the fights, at least imo, much more interesting and require more thinking and strategizing ahead.
However, the controls on a keyboard are still annoying to grasp and the game stops responding whenever I switch to another window and back to the game.
So even though I realize it is possible that the problems are on my machine rather than in the game itself, I personally can't recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991157647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 1420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1282, 'last_played': 1556251895}
review:
I can see myself enjoying this game for awhile. You gotta be into grid-based turn based strategy games and actually like Noire (Lady Black Heart) as a character though. If grid-based turn based strategy games and Noire are something you don't like much this game will be awful for you.

Noire is my favorite character though and I love grid based strategy games so this is a friggen 10/10 for me!

I'd go into detail about the gameplay but really, if you've played a grid-based strategy game then this is nothing new but it's fun regardless.

Story-wise, so far it's the same story you'd expect from a Neptune game, complete and utter nonsense and silliness which Idea Factory does so well!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000878931', 'num_games_owned': 1177, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 1863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1450, 'last_played': 1523912913}
review:
This game has fan service written all over it. If your a fan of the hyper dimension series im sure theres something here for you. I like those games myself but... theres a flaw and it has to do with the actual battle maps 

The battle maps are fine in a sense but theres traps in some of them instead of being there for you to avoid moving on to the tile a lot of them are positioned in a way to just be annoying.I especially hate replaying certain maps because of that problem and if you are trying to 100% this game which im not. You will have to replay certain main story chapter fights which has those annoying traps in them. 

The gameplay it self is a simple stradegy game you move around a  tile based grid doing whatever objectives are thrown at you.Most of the time it's kill everything on the screen. 
This game is a departure from the main series as it has absolutly no dungeon exploring in it which i thought was a let down other then the map designs.

The main lead this time is noire and neptune clearly breaks the fourth wall and let's you know she does not like it. So be ready for a lot of statements like that. Im in the middle of reccomending this game to bad there isn't an option for that. i'll give this a thumbs up purly for the fan service. But just know it's a mixed bag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067743804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 4408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4406, 'last_played': 1568110373}
review:
Never underestimate a game, based on it's Platform :D 
This Vita turned Steam title is truly an Idea Factory Gem.
Revolving around all out warfare, between cities and Generals, the story is addictive, the characters are all unforgettable,  references are on overload and content is brimming from every pore.

It plays similiar to a Fire Emblem title, only with humor at every turn and characters Neptunia fans can appreciate. I sunk 73 hours on my first play through and it was all content from start to finish.

This game is not always easy and can be mentally exhausting, where some maps could take up of 20 to 30 mins to complete, while some story missions pit you in 4 battle maps without a chance to pause at Lastation to restock. You're given the chance to save between maps and it's always helpful to save when ever possible.

Those DLC items, unfortunately are a must have for Chapter 9 missions and submission, to skip a large portion of grinding, but it's usually just the 4 CPU's that truly benefit from the DLC gear (Nep, Noire, Blanc, Vert)

I'd grab this title on sale just so you can pick up all the DLC at half price, it's really helpful at end game but should not be used from the start as it's game breaking overpowered gear. 

I hope we return to this dimension again :D while we don't have Candidates it's still such a great world!!!
I Nepping Love Ya'll Peace o/

author: {'steamid': '76561198090812798', 'num_games_owned': 2721, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 5931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2316, 'last_played': 1593108828}
review:
[h1]TL;DR:[/h1]
A generic and punishing turn based stragety RPG game with numerous difficulty spikes and grind walls.

Overall Rating:
[h1]4/10[/h1] 

[h1]Gameplay: Average
Controls: Good
Stability: Very Good
Graphics: Above-Average
Difficulty: Very Poor
Sounds: Very Good
Music: Good
Story: Poor[/h1]

Hyperdevotion Noire: Goddess Black Heart is a spin off turn based stragety RPG game based in the Hyperdimension Neptunia game series (non-canon). The game let's you control up to around six to eight characters per mission and aswell as having to battle against various enemy types and completing various objectives, the game also features small puzzle platforming sections that often awards the player with loot such as items and crafting ingredients.

[h1]PROS/CONS[/h1]
[b]+ New Unique Characters[/b]
All side characters (other than Compa and Iffy DLC Characters) that appeared in all the other Hyperdimension games do not make an apperance in this game, but are replaced with new game exlusive and memorable controllable chatacters that are introduced with unique personalities, ablities and playstyle.

[b]- Grindfest[/b]
Personally, I don't mind having to grind in most RPG games or in most other Hyperdimension games to an extent, but just the idea of having to constantly grind and replaying the same missions in a slow paced turn based stragety game just to earn 100% achievement completion or bypass certain grind walls just feels mind-numbingly tedious. If you're planning to play the game on Normal or Hard difficulty, expect to bump into a lot of grind walls.

[b]- Overly-Punishing Debuffs[/b]
When you thinking of debuffs for an RPG game, you'd be expecting debuffs like Poison and Skill-Seal right? Well this game has those, but do you know what other debuffs they have? How about the Love debuff that makes your controlled characters use up your limited healing items on a boss/enemy against your will and skip their turn? Or the Zombie debuff that turns your controlled character into a zombie and they use their strongest attack against your other controlled characters on their turn which often results in them instantly dying? It's also worth mentioning that the debuffs in the games are near impossible to avoid and predict. Debuffs like Love and Zombie can only be treated after the devestating effects of those debuffs had already been done just after the AI's turn is over. Be sure to bring Resta and Leefi with you.

[b]- Difficulty Spikes[/b]
Even when playing the game on the easiest difficulty setting, there are certain missions where the enemies/boss can be insanely difficult to fight against that they even have the ability to instantly wipe out a group of your controlled characters, and if that wasn't hard enough, why not face against two insanely hard bosses whilst under a turn limit and having to spread your controlled characters to complete one of the other objectives? 

[b]- No Cloud Saving[/b]
Since every other Hyperdimension Neptunia games on Steam feature cloud storage saving, surely this game would have it too, right? Wrong. I've lost around 15-20 hours of progress from the game after reinstalling Windows on my computer and I was dissapointed to found out afterwards that this was the only HDN game selling on the Steam Store that does not support Steam Cloud Storage saving. I'm sure most other players who had realized this also ended up losing their save progress too without warning.

[h1]CONCLUSION:[/h1]
I just don't understand how anyone would find any enjoyment out of the main core of this game, espeically if they're playing on any difficulty setting higher than Easy. The game quickly gets boring and repetitive after a while and at a certain point in the game, even when playing on the easiest difficulty setting, the game can feel insanely difficult when fighting certain bosses and enemies that often have an unfair advantage over the player.

[h1]TL;DR:[/h1]
A generic and punishing turn based stragety RPG game with numerous difficulty spikes and grind walls.

[h1]RECOMENDED FOR THOSE WHO PLAY:[/h1]
XCOM: Enemy Unknown

review:
In all honesty I don't mind the self insert. My personal issues are:

1. No dialogue choices. What's the point of a self insert if you can't even choose what to say? That wouldn't be an issue but that brings me to point number 2 which is perhaps the biggest issue for me.

2. I've only been playing the game for like 15-20 minutes and I already hate myself (AKA Mr. Self Insert) His dialogue is cringy and he may as well be kissing and licking her feet.

"OMG ITS THE GODDESS NOIRE HUREREINORHNHNDKLJ. FORGIVE ME YOUR MAJESTY!"

Considering this is a self insert this is NOT how I/other people would act it breaks the immersion and it's cringy as hell to read. I haven't played much further but I'll get back into the game. Hopefully next time if they decide to do another male self insert at least give us the option to not act like a damn beta male.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156762049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1543331893}
review:
By many people this is consideered the worst neptunia spin off and i would have to agree.

The game crashes constantly. In the middle of a battle? crash. After you complete a battle? better save quickly or else it will randomly freeze and crash. Using objects that move on the battle field? Risky...they often cause crashes.

Storywise it's much differnt. You play a self insert character and the game is basicly a power fantasy for Noire. They introduce a ton of very shallow but cute new girls (generals) and you basicly go around collecting/beating/befriending them.

The gameplay is a tactics square grid. The enemies have very generic attacks like "fire" and "crush" and "wind" no matter what type of enemy it is.

Overall the game is fun and it's cute but the constant crashing keeps me from recomending the game :(

review: It's a Neptunia game. There really isn't much to say about it, you can't really describe neptunia games at all other than somehow great and bad at the same time...except this one. Self-insert main character? What the heck were they thinking, this is Neptunia, there are no male characters, but now the mani character is a some random male who is supposed to be a love interest for Noire? 0/10/ However, the other characters are still all the neptunia-styled parody characters, so everything else is great. The gameplay isn't as fluid as a usual SRPG, but I can get over that. Overall, it was fun, except for that one thing...

author: {'steamid': '76561198192111605', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 6120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5513, 'last_played': 1527430344}
review:
The one where Noire took Neptune's role as the protag and have many friends

+ The gameplay is quite similar to chess. the batlle would took longer time to clear it, and it requires more strategies and thinking than the rebirth trilogy. quite fun

- I'm not against putting self-insert male character into the game. i actually longing for it. but NOT giving him any choice of words to speak at all is a sin. this character also barely "appear" in the main story, so sometimes when nore talks to him, you would think "oh yeah, forgot he was there"

+ Despite all that, I really enjoy watching his interactions with Noire in SIM NOIRE. I hope they implement something like this more in the future.

- Achievement won't pop out unless you quit the game. You're still able to get it, but it just feel uncomfortable

- One thing that i really don't get is, WHY THE HECK THEY USE ULTRADIMENSION'S GODDESSESS AND EVEN HISTOIRE, BUT THEY USE NEPTUNE FOR PLANEPTUNE INSTEAD OF PLUTIA???. I don't hate you Neptune, but seeing more of Plutia would be nice. Your name isn't even in the title this time, so get over it.

+ Although in chibi, the skill animations are a lot better here.

- The one I hate the most would be the lily achievement. 100 rank for all 22 character? Seriously????

Well, despite the hate, this game is actually pretty decent. Not the best, but it's not that bad either (NepU is still worse)

[b] 6.5/10	[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198134300479', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5673, 'last_played': 1565522823}
review:
Once I finished the first 2 games in the franchise I was pretty much satiated with the whole thing, especially after I heard everything else in the franchise is largely the same. Except for this. I figured I'll give it a try since Neptune is not the main protagonist here and supposedly some of the main things have changed. After playing Re;birth 1 and 2, it feels odd to play this. Some of the core mechanics are still the same, but the new ones play a big role to the point when it doesn't even seem like the unchanged ones are the same. The gameplay is different, but actual combat is A LOT slower. The movement, the pecking slides, the cutscenes for SP moves... I disabled all of that to speed things up + it makes it less obvious to my parents that I'm a disappointment. Some things also take longer to grind and even though the game explains every mechanic before it first occurs, there's just so many of them that you have to come back to them and read a few times more.

The controls are weird, it takes some time to get used to them. One thing in particular is how the game supposedly has controller options but they don't even register as input devices (yes I tried multiple ones).

Finally, the story. Compared to what I played before this, the dialogues are a lot funnier and it's a satisfying feeling to follow someone who was previously less important, even though it's not the same story setting. 

Overall, it's highly recommended to play at least one other game in the franchise before going for this one because even if you're familiar with it already, it still takes some time to get the ball rolling, but it's worthwhile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003079730', 'num_games_owned': 969, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1509903382}
review:
Self. Insert. Male. Character.
Like really.
I can forgive locked 30fps with constant drops, horrible hqx filter on every sprite and menu, bad ""localization"" with tons of lolsorandumb jokes, music not looping properly, lagging menus, cursor forgetting its position in most menus, tons of introduced boring literally whos with close to none background and events you have to grind lily ranks with to get true ending, worst lily rank grind among all nep games, lot of events being unvoiced, broken resolution changing, broken windowed mode, broken alt-tabbing, inability to skip attack animations unless turned off completely in options, inability to skip intros with gamepad, random crashes, nepawful enslish voices enabled by default, tons of P2W DLCs that costs same as a base game, the whole "requests" feature that is more random than Neptune, more stupid than Compa and more illogical than Rey's actions. And Nep knows what else, I can forgive all of it just for the sake of Neps. But "self-insert male character" is something you DON'T put in Nep game.
0/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198273426047', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6763, 'last_played': 1538772080}
review:
It is a pretty good game.

First, if you like animu girls then theres dozen of them here. With Noire as the main protag, this game brings back the lovely CPU characters and plenty of others. the story is pretty typical of the neptunia series with saving the world and all that. what pulls me in is the interaction between the girls and the funny dialogues.

the gameplay is pretty neat with strategy elements. However, i find it pretty easy and had trouble only on several levels even on hard. To 100% the achievement list is pretty tedious though but if you dont care for all of that then it is pretty great. for all the story elements you could finish it in 20 hours or so.

my only main complain with this game is it crashed a lot when on full-screen mode especially when you skip the battle animations. however  when i switched to borderless, the crash problems stops (well, mostly).

All and all, i would give the game 7.5/10. it would be higher if the crashes did not occur so frequently however it does not  diminish my enjoyment for the game. 

Also, Noire has no friends, Moru best girl.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087475757', 'num_games_owned': 1643, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 2328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2311, 'last_played': 1507095325}
review:
Mixed review

- The Good: Cute characters, funny dialogue, good voice acting, the game is lewd sometimes, ok story and soundtrack, pretty good game mechanics (requires some planning/thinking, especially for near end-game battles)

- The Bad: Random game crashes (make sure to save after battles cause there's no autosave.) Game is rather too long and overstays its welcome, there are too many characters with similar enough skills that I rarely use them in battles. Pay-to-win DLCs..

- The UGLY: Too much GRINDING! Seriously, if you don't like grindy games then don't even think about trying this game. There're many reasons you need to grind for the game: To actually win battles, to get materials for making items, to unlock better weapons, to collect coins for buying stuff and decorating house, to obtain achievements, to get true ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186798749', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 2873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2831, 'last_played': 1529919373}
review: Although I like the series, I have to give honest opinion about this game. The chibi style is new and refreshing while the story is still goofy and funny. However, the game is just tooo freaking irritating. Map can takes over 10 turns to complete and you need to grind for lily rank if you want the true ending, moreover the lily rank in this game is really horrible and time-consuming. The last boss is just too overpowered and took me quite a long time to figure out how to beat it. Overall, if you like the series very much and dont want to miss out on any neptunia games, buy it. Otherwise, i'd totally not reccomended this for not-fan players. Rated 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198089299679', 'num_games_owned': 7216, 'num_reviews': 392, 'playtime_forever': 5591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3229, 'last_played': 1506249847}
review:
Unlike my most review where I give my verdict at the end. I will say it in the very front I will not rate this highly.

No... I am not a Noire hater even though she is not in my top 5 favorite. (I think Yellow Heart makes a better wifu.) Instead I love this entire Hyperdimension Neptunia Franchise and I really think Hyperdevotion Noire add some much needed game variety to this RPG series with some battle chess strategy. 

What really bring down the scoring for me are grindingâ€¦ Ya, this entire series is very heavy on grinding but this one is still way over the top. You finish this game with around 30-50 battles which will take average 15 minutes each fight plus story in VN like dialogues and then once you finish your playthough you will realize that about another 50 hours to grinding for lily rank achievements(including the true ending). Those once fun pecking heart animation that show up for team support are enough to make your eye bleed after viewing it for hundreds of times. 

Now everything else was quite well done. The big head animation style is not for everyone but its very fun for me see noire and the whole gang like that. Music is the same quality from this entire series and quite decent as it is. Story is quite still as there is now a main character (you) that show up as a secretary to Noire which made me quite uncomfortable at time as this series has always been about girls and no boy. Plotâ€¦ could been better as you really donâ€™t understand what happened to noire and her share until the very end. 

There are also a bit bug left and I recommend save after every fight as sometime random crush do happen.

6.0/10â€¦ A Game for the hyperdevoted fan only and a barely thumb up. This depress me a bit and I hope the next game I play in this series is better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156535304', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1508835565}
review:
Positive: 
+ New neptunia game
+ New mechanics and gameplay 
+ Noire as lead 

Negative: 
- Too many characters
- So many frustrating bugs
- Bosses just love to go to the traps and not get penalized for it. 

So far this is the most disappointing neptunia game for me due to the issues for just playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086569252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1503244780}
review:
Overall a mediocre strategy rpg that I would not recommend. 

The team was clearly inexperienced in the genre and they missed a bunch of basic quality of life improvements that would improve the game's flow.

The game also has annoying mechanics like the Lily System which encourages players to group their units together in awkward ways in order to build up resources for special attacks. The obvious downside is that enemies can easily attack large groups of units. While one would think the extra layer of strategy would make gameplay more interesting, the frustration builds up and makes it unenjoyable.

There are also stage hazards on the map. In order to avoid passing over these hazards, the player needs to take into account the direction their characters are facing at the start of a turn. This will determine the path that a character takes to move to any new location. The unfortunate side effect is that players need to position themselves in a way that allows enemies to easily score back or side attacks for additional damage. This was definitely not implemented well and left me feeling annoyed any time a new hazard was introduced.

review:
Even though I like this franchise, I really cannot recommend this game.
This is just too buggy. The game crashes / freezes randomly. The BGM never loops properly. The plot is very uninteresting.

Ironically, this game's mechanics is very well designed compared to the other nep games, but all these bugs are just unbearable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049183341', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 3272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3272, 'last_played': 1502193891}
review:
Spin-off exclusivamente centrado en Noire, con gameplay tÃ¡ctico por turnos y toques de simulador.

Antes que nada, comentar que nos encontramos antes [b]el peor port de toda la franquicia[/b]. [b]Rinde a 30FPS, no tiene Steam Cloud, los logros saltan una vez cierras el juego, si minimizas el juego se pasa a modo ventana porque sÃ­, etc...[/b] Vamos, un despropÃ³sito. Por eso, de oferta, puedes encontrarlo incluso mÃ¡s barato que R;B1. Hasta ellos son conscientes del churro de port que es.

Bueno, ahora hablemos del juego en sÃ­:

[b]GrÃ¡ficamente, es malo.[/b] Opta por una [b]estÃ©tica chibi[/b] (que no digo que sea mala), pero todos los modelos son [b]demasiado poligonados[/b], y grÃ¡ficamente, [b]es un bajÃ³n respecto al resto de tÃ­tulos[/b]. Te acostumbras rÃ¡pido a sus grÃ¡ficos, pero "duelen", ya que los otros tÃ­tulos demostraron un mucho mejor apartado grÃ¡fico.

[b]En cuanto al apartado sonoro, estÃ¡ mÃ¡s o menos en la media.[/b] La banda sonora estÃ¡ compuesta por temas reciclados de los tres Re;Birth, aunque tiene alguno que otro nuevo. [b]Pero la mÃºsica, en los niveles, loopea fatal. Se corta, y vuelve a comenzar.[/b] Eso sÃ­, el doblaje sigue siendo excelente.

[b]Jugablemente, es muy fiel a los Re;Birth, con muchos extras[/b]. Tenemos los mismos objetos, equipamiento, sistema de Planos, etc... La base, es la misma. Pero ademÃ¡s, tiene otros extras como muuuuuchos problemas de estado (y muy originales), el hecho de que si realizamos una habilidad PH pegado a otro personaje, este hace mÃ¡s daÃ±o y consume menos PHs, etc... No estÃ¡ nada mal, es muy sÃ³lida. [b]Es casi un Re;Birth pero tÃ¡ctico.[/b]

A medida que avancemos, nos encontraremos con [b]una buena variedad de mapas[/b] (algunas son mazmorras de los Re;Birth, me ha gustado ese detalle) [b]llenos de distintas condiciones, objetivos, interacciones con el escenario, etc... [/b]Eso me ha gustado mucho, ya que [b]hasta el final, casi cada nivel trae algo nuevo, y lo hace muy variado.[/b]

TambiÃ©n me ha sorprendido [b]la dificultad del tÃ­tulo.[/b] Lo he jugado en normal, algunos niveles y jefes [b]me han costado bastante, todo e ir bien de nivel.[/b] Si no tenÃ©is paciencia, [b]puede llegar a desesperar.[/b]

Pero, Â¿quÃ© hace, en mi opiniÃ³n, tirar por la borda todas las bondades dichas sobre la jugabilidad hasta ahora? [b]Pues el ritmo de esta.[/b]

[b]Es un juego muuuuuuuuuy lento, con turnos que se hacen muy muy pesados[/b], debido a la lentitud de la jugabilidad ([b]sobretodo el turno de los enemigos[/b], que es lento para rabiar). Debido a eso, [b]los niveles se hacen larguÃ­simos[/b], alargando un nivel que con la rapidez de un Disgaea, te harÃ­as en cinco minutos, hasta los 30. [b]Al menos, el juego cuenta con un sistema de guardado rÃ¡pido por si tenemos que irnos en mitad de un nivel.[/b]

El tÃ­tulo cuenta con [b]buena duraciÃ³n, tardÃ© unas 40 horas en completar la historia principal.[/b] LÃ¡stima que [b]no tenga postgame ni absolutamente nada de rejugabilidad[/b] (cosa rara en un Neptunia, ya que suelen hacerlo bien en este apartado).

[b]En resumen, buen RPG tÃ¡ctico con una jugabilidad de lo mÃ¡s sÃ³lida, que se ve brutalmente mermado por el lento ritmo de esta[/b], haciendo el juego bastante coÃ±azo. 

Si eres muy fan de Noire y quieres demostrar su devociÃ³n hacia ella, cÃ³mpralo, tienes Noire para rato.

Si no, aunque sea un buen juego, [b]piensa muy bien si vas a tener paciencia suficiente para su jugabilidad y hasta dirÃ­a que su dificultad.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198196098874', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2002, 'last_played': 1512091231}
review:
Oh man. Ohhhhhh man. Noire got her own game. Man oh man.

What truths can one speak about Hyperdevotion that haven't been spoken already?

Uh... If Megadimension was a matured teenager, Hyperdevotion is a pet rabbit. There you go, that probably hasn't been said before. Don't get me wrong, they're more similar than you might think. The key difference is that movement is much more prominent in the former, going out and exploring dungeons on a world map, whereas in the latter, there are small hops from battlefield to battlefield, and even hops on the battlefield traversing from space to space on a grid system. Besides that, they're very similar. Both need feeding regularly, shed body hair periodically, and squeak loudly when something bothers them.

Sorry, what the fuck was I talking about? Oh yeah, Hyperdevotion. Right.

Strip away the bobbleheads for a second (not in that way, as much as you may wish), and the gameplay is actually very similar to what we're used to in a lot of respects. Plans are still a thing, you still get loot from grinding against enemies, you can only attack targets in the immediate vicinity (albeit that now means one at a time; blame grid movement for that one), Thunder Tits still gets Gungnir, Nep continues to nep, Blanc is still as flat as Wii Fit board, and Noire still, in her own game no less, manages to get herself trapped in weird and oftentimes humiliating situations.

The gameplay is a little different to usual, but they're all moves we're familiar with. What really stands out are the status effects, which are way more expansive than usual and I really want to see these make appearances in the main series, which I've always thought was lacking in terms of statuses. I'd like to see all of them show up again, because they're fun to play with. Well, all of them except Tofu. Screw Tofu. I will never forgive Vio for what she did to my tiny soldiers. It's only funny the first five or six times before it gets frustrating as all hell.

Story is simple enough as usual, not going into it in much detail here, play the fucking game if you want to know the exact details, but Arfoire does bad stuff again and now you travel around the world recruiting, or in some cases re-recruiting... generals?

Wait, wait, wait. The CPUs get their own [i]armies[/i]? People, an entire nation at that, trust [i]Neppers McGee[/i] over here with an [b][i]army[/i][/b]?!

Well, I can see why this particular instance of Gamindustri went to crap as fast as it did. Oh, sorry, Gamarket. Yeah, the name's different this time. It's... never really addressed. From what I can tell, the only major difference is that the candidates aren't around now. Which is kind of sad, since I really would've liked to see chibi Rom and Ram, not to mention chibi Uni. The imoutos would have been really freaking cute here.

Except for Nepgear. This is what she gets for her actions in the Conquest Ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114339588', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3957, 'last_played': 1504553722}
review:
TL;WR: Awesome nep spin-off. 9/10. 

With this, I've played all of Neptunia's spin-offs released on steam. This might be the best one, or at least tied with SeHa Girls. In this game, the player sort of takes part in the story. He is Secretary-san, employed by Noire. I noticed many people hate this, but it wasn't bad at all. He barely talks during the story and it's never too important. I say "he" because this guy is really his own character, you don't actually get to choose what he says like on a visual novel. Story was OK, the best part of nep games has always been the funny character interactions and that's still here. Here are the pros and cons:

PROS

+ Great strategy gameplay. I really enjoyed the battles. Though I suggest you play something like a GBA Fire Emblem or even the mmo Wakfu first if you're unsure you'll like this.
+ Bunch of characters to choose from. There's a looot of girls this time around. Each of them with their own unique abilities and leader passive effects. The missions usually allow you to bring an average of 5~7 units so you can make different strategies.
+ Well-thought levels. Most levels differ hugely from each other, and each of them will require a different approach. Whether it's an open field where you can go all-out or a narrow pathway filled with traps to be carefully dodged, I enjoyed all of them. Okay, except one that had a little too many traps.
+ Girls will give each other a peck on the cheek when are close by and use skills. This reduces the SP cost of the used skill and fills up the Lily Meter, which is used to go HDD, deploy more units or use a Special Move (EXE). You can set the little kiss scene to be skipped, if you wish.
+ In the settings you can also make the game skip every battle animation and double the moving speed. Useful if you're just interested in playing and wants to make things more fluid and fast.
+ Fun little side-game called Sim Noire where decorate her room with talking furniture and help her answer citizen's requests. Purely optional, but it gives you some items and unlocks several events between Noire and the Secretary.
+ Not as long as the mainline games, but not too short like the other spin-offs. You get more for your money.

NEUTRAL

> I think the Secretary was a nice little addition, but it'd be better if he was a proper character, given his own face and voice. This guy isn't you, he doesn't say what you think or does what you want.
> Chibi graphics. I'm not a big fan of them, but I know some people will love it. Even for chibi, their heads are a little too big.
> The writing is usually good, but there a few times where it can be really odd.
> Besides elements, the game has different types of damage like Pierce, Slash, Blunt, Shoot and etc. which is really awesome, but it never tells you who does what kind of damage and which enemy resists which kind of damage! You can sort of tell by their weapons, but not always. Vert is obviously Pierce, but what about Ai, the idol girl who uses a microphone?


CONS

- Elemental chests are a good addition to gameplay. They must be opened by opened by an attack of a stronger element. However, many levels have exactly one chest of each element, "forcing" you to always equip four characters with a specific element crystal to open each chest. This can get tiring, but you can just ignore them if you wish. Will miss out on materials to develop items, though.
- It doesn't bother me that enemies can't be affected by traps, but I wish there would be at least something you could use against them. Like in Fire Emblem games where you can shoot your enemies with their own ballista if you take control of it.

I'll wrap this up by saying that I really enjoyed this game, and that if you're a Neptunia fan and like strategy games, you'll surely like this one. It was great!

author: {'steamid': '76561198273264793', 'num_games_owned': 535, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 5710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5710, 'last_played': 1558869400}
review:
Pros:
- Have a chibi Noire
- Have a nice in game art gallery
- a decent turn based strategy games
- Have a multiple Ending (although it's only true and good ending)

Cons:
- 30 fps
- too many side characters i don't even use
- this game is heavily grind but if you play the game just for fun then go for it
- easy to get bored within a few hours gameplay
- no replay value
- this game is pay to win if you bought it with all the dlc's bundle because you will get the ultimate equipment set for all the characters from the beginning so you don't have to worry about collecting materials and crafting equipment anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059517244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1442, 'last_played': 1510835157}
review:
Fun and simple game to play, in chibi style. Storyline is simple and characteras are funny. The battle system is interesting to say the least, it's like a turn-based boardgame. Japanese subtitles would be appreciated though, hopefully added some day; because the English translation is hardly on point, as usual...though there is at least japanese voice. Different to previous titles, you actually play as a character inside the story o.o bought the game at 85% off definintely worth the money
-17 hours in- waiting for enemy turns may be tedious to some...so don't fail missions! or just use retreat option there is no penalty

author: {'steamid': '76561198200519807', 'num_games_owned': 857, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 65414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1590085931}
review:
Another awesome nep series, but this time, our tsundere Noire will be the lead protagonist. Sound interesting, right?

+New battle system (turn-based strategy) make a new battle experience for nep series.
+Many characters with different equipment and skills. Unfortunetely this game not included the Goddess's Sisters.
+Various battle stage with high creativity level design.
+Cute and awesome graphic with good soundtrack.
+And... of course this game is still a NEP SERIES !!!

-Some stage is just really really hard, even with DLCs (Especially the stage with a zombie as the enemy). And too many DLCs for this series (one character one DLC equipment).

Recommended: nep/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198102063164', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1522593086}
review:
Hyperdevotion Noire is what I personally consider to be the [b]worst Neptunia game in the whole series.[/b] Spin-off or otherwise. This game, just as a whole, is god awful. This is the one time that I just never bothered to finish a Neptunia game because I just could not stomach sitting through this messy, sloppy hack-job of a game. Hyperdevotion Noire is really the bottom of the barrel when it comes to the Neptunia series.

Even as a fan of the series I found it really difficult to enjoy this game. I'm all for the concept of giving each main Neptunia character their own game focused on them, after all - MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune vs. Zombies was a decent side-show and Superdimension Neptune vs. Sega Hard Girls was a [i]really[/i] good spin on the Neptunia formula, but Hyperdevotion falls flat on its face in pretty much every single aspect.

The game fails in its two most important categories, those being story and gameplay. The biggest issue with the story is the self-insert "protagonist" and how they're meant to represent [i]you[/i] - the player. They are...unnecessary in the biggest way possible. And more often than not - they are the antithesis of what you, as a player, are thinking. Perhaps I'm an idiot and that was the whole joke, in which case - fair enough (after all, their name does get changed from "Player" to "Secretary" very early on), but even with that in mind - this game has some of the worst fanfiction-esque writing in the entire series. I'm serious, the story in this game genuinely reads like a really bad Neptunia fanfiction.

In terms of gameplay, it's an SRPG or Strategy Role Playing Game. That would be fine if the game just wasn't so ridiculously slow. Seriously, it's just so incredibly BORING and SLOW. On top of that - unfair! By that, I mean the AI can, more often than not, outright cheat. One important detail to remember is that the AI is unaffected by stage hazards. Only your party is! That, coupled with the insanely slow, tedious and monotonous gameplay, makes it frustrating. It will take you so long to get done with a single stage (I clocked up to 50 minutes on just [i]one stage[/i] - and that was very early on!) - it's the main reason I just decided to say "screw it", dropped the game and never picked it back up. And I'm not planning to pick it back up because that was [i]after[/i] a horrible first impression.

Just...stay away from this game. It's slow, it's boring, it's unfair and it's just not interesting in any way. This is genuinely the worst that the Neptunia series has to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162864353', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1506041752}
review:
So I bought this game as part of the most recent Steam Sale, I'm a huge supporter of the games made by Idea Factory and Compile Heart.

The game was going well up until I get to the sub mission involving fighting IF and then the dragon afterwards. When it got to the Dragon's first turn, as soon as it did its attack, all sound cut out.

Music, SFX, Voice. All of it, just silent.

The game continued to play normally despite the sound, but as I continued on in the fight against the dragon, I ended up having a huge graphical slowdown. Just the game and nothing else. Internet Browser still worked fine, every other application worked fine. It was just this game.

I'm still recommending it as a fan of the Neptunia series, but I hope this isn't a continuing issue.

Also, I didn't notice, but the achievements never popped up until I closed the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174053214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2574, 'last_played': 1494710783}
review:
We'll start with a quick summary for this one: if you haven't played a Neptune game yet, this is not the first one you should pick (unless you really like strategy rpgs and dislike jrpgs).  I'll still recommend the first Hyperdimension if you haven't tried one at all.  If you have played them and love the games and the characters and interactions, then this has more of the same fun wackiness that is Nep-Nep, but the actual gameplay may feel more of a grind and 'in the way' of seeing the story and interactions.

You actually play the role of a guy that is in the Nep-Nep world, and you end up helping Noire out with a situation, and from there you continue to follow Noire and help her deal with what's happening in Gamindustry.  And from there, the story continues: not everyone likes this kind of 'twist' to a Nep-Nep game, so that's why I mention it.  I didn't mind the idea, but the interactions between Noire and the 'player' are about 50/50: half funny, and half just awfully awkward.  There are also a bunch of new characters introduced, and the interactions with these characters are MUCH better and interesting for the most part: this is the best part of the game.

The story is about the same quality as most Neptune stories.  The music IS the same as other Neptunes (actually a lot is recycled, but if you played any more than one Neptune game you know what it's going to be like).  The gameplay... well... perhaps it's because I don't have much time to sit down and play these games, but it felt really slow and frustrating (I hate crates and stacking them to reach areas that are too high, and also traps in general: others probably like that it adds variety to the missions.  If you really like strategy games, this will be a fun thing: if you just want to see the interactions like I do... well, prepare yourself!)

And the final thing: Neptune games are known to have lots of grinding to them, especially if you love achievements and unlocking everything.  If this is you, then this game is even MORE grinding than most other Neptune games: I bypassed a great deal of achievements because... well, I lack patience, lol.  

It has enough fun and humor and interactions for me to recommend the game, but I'd wait for a sale for this one.  I'd imagine most other Neptune games would be a better pick to get while you wait for a sale here.  That's if you are looking for *another* Neptune game: if you haven't tried one, pick the first one first!

author: {'steamid': '76561198108296385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 9646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5815, 'last_played': 1495603503}
review: One of the best SRPGs I've played since Fire Emblem. The game is as difficult as you want it to be making it great for all skill levels. There is a lot of grinding though especially if you're trying to make the weapon plans. Love the new characters and the chibi style design though sad that Uni isn't in it even though Noire is the main character. This might be my favorite Neptunia game in the series so far or at the very least tied at the top with Rebirth 1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041636869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 15110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14475, 'last_played': 1491129685}
review:
A tactical combat game set in the Gamindustri universe. This time around  you play as Noire, not Nepture, the battle are tactical, and the charactesr are chibi-style during the main game. Otherwise, if youâ€™ve played the previous games, you will likely enjoy this one as well. A warning, the Lily achievements are even more grinding than anything in the other games. 

On a side note, I really want to buy the chibi-style characters as figures.

review:
More fun and Addicting than i thought it would be. 

- Fun and challenging combat.
- Very tough and challenging side missions to complete.
- Lots of characters.
- The story and characters are kinda fun.

i wasn't expecting much but it really surprised me in a good way and took so many hourse of my time.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198073332210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2534, 'last_played': 1506470794}
review:
Juego bastante divertido de principio a fin, muy buen juego de estrategia con mecanicas que por lo menos yo no habia visto antes, como daÃ±o por caida y mucho juego con alturas y plataformas, musica genial.
La historia es muy buena y muy divertida, no solo por la manera en que esta escrita, sino por la forma en la que los personajes reaccionan a ella, hace buen uso de topicos burlÃ¡ndose de ellos en el proceso y ademas tiene diversas referencias a muchos videojuegos y cultura "friki".
Solo hay una parte que no me convence. Los personajes estan muy bien hechos y algunos sino todos son mas interesantes que el cuarteto protagonista, pero se les deja demaciado de lado en la historia y solo aparecen en momentos puntuales o sus "capitulos". 
Historia: 9/10
Jugabilidad 8/10
Sonido: 9/10
Personajes: 22 Waifus/10

 A historia comeÃ§a quando as 4 deusas estÃ£o lutando em gamemarket pelo controle, apÃ³s Noire derrotar as outras 3 deusas, Noire acaba sendo enganada por um mulher chamada Eno jÃ¡ que Noire queria trazer a paz sem precisar lutar, e como resultado de ser enganada,Noire perde seu poder e como resultados adicionais as outras deusas tambÃ©m, apÃ³s uma briga e discussÃ£o,fica decidido que as deusas tenham que se unir e juntar todos os generais devolta a sua equipe para entÃ£o derrotar Eno, e sim, espere 4th wall breakings e referencias a outros games que vÃ£o de metal gear,Dragon quest,Street Fighter e etc

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198057219226', 'num_games_owned': 1390, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 4764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2727, 'last_played': 1481487455}
review:
Hyperdevotion Noire is a typical cheaply made srpg packed with all the cliches of the genre. Buy it in case of you're satisfied everything with NepNep & co (might want to consider buing also unlock cinematics dlc). Otherwise what awaits you is a game with worst writing of the series where the actual game consist of repetitive maps filled with cheating enemies that play with very different rules to compensate completely missing AI. Occasional super moves that come out of the nowhere might be tolerable but the thing that enemies ignore rules of floor tiles and stand idly if they can't attack player within current turn, leaves the strategic experience very lacking.

What boggles me most is why they didn't bother to fix looping of bgm tracks... Now the music ends and starts abruptly and it is very audible. Why????

author: {'steamid': '76561198091844152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2343, 'last_played': 1471114262}
review: Well Noire/Black Heart is my waifu, so obviously I'd recommend this game. If you want a serious review, this is basically a spin off of your average Neptunia game. Instead of the normal turn based RPG, you have something pretty similar to what I would relate to Fire Emblem. If you liked playing Fire Emblem, you're going to have more fun than what I've seen from other reviews. I'd enjoyed it personally because obviously waifu,waifu waifu, <3 and the events with Noire/Black Heart and the Secretary (aka you). One of my favorite scenes is the love triangle, I won't spoil it though. One more thing I would like to rant about is that the Noire from Hyperdimension and Ultradimension are DIFFERENT. I'm tired hearing people say they dislike Noire, but don't say specifically which Noire. Yes, they're pretty similar but the minor differences do make a difference, they're 2 different Noires/Black Hearts in seperate dimensions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043575278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 6790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3559, 'last_played': 1481334201}
review:
TL;DR -> Buy this game if you are both a fan of the series and a fan of SRPGs.

Let me start by saying that Hyperdevotion Noire: Goddess Black Heart is a good SRPG. It's not mindblowing, it plays like any SRPG out there, but its loveable characters and art style makes it stand out a little bit.
HOWEVER.
It could've been polished a lot.

- Sound tracks loop BADLY. You can tell whenever the track ends and starts over after a second delay, and that happens for every track.
- The "Cutscenes" animation is better than any of the RE;Birth games, making use of more movement and special effects, but the moving mouths are a pink pixelated mess.
- Humor is not there. It's not remotely as funny as other Neptunia games.
- Plot is boring and lazy. Noire as a lead character works even worse than Nepgear.

And it has its fair share of BS: enemies at low health are set to spam their EXE every turn. EVERY TURN! Not to be that guy that goes like "That's not fair!" but that's not fair. One is enough to oneshot any character it hits, there is absolutely no reason to make them go IDKFA.
Also, I DESPISE Sim Noire. It would've been good if some form of multiple choice dialogue was added, so you could have SOMETHING to pick the correct answer to the requests, but no. Instead you HAVE to use a guide. You used it, don't lie.
I don't like the flirty bits with secretary san either, it's very bad fanservice made just so that Noire fans could jack off being verbally abused by Tsundere Heart. I mean, if that's your thing I'm perfectly okay with it, but I didn't care AT ALL, especially because it doesn't belong neither in a Neptunia game, nor in an SRPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034308123', 'num_games_owned': 586, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 1430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1405, 'last_played': 1476066359}
review:
Finally, by a well-known studio who brought you the Dept. Heaven series Sting, this is a game where I can produce Chihaya on her way to top idol by getting popularity, fans, and money around the world. On this arduous journey, more and more other idols will be available to you but you don't care about that because you're playing it for Chihaya. You get to please her as usual by scraping off points from the nearest department store andusing said points by upgrading her bedroom.

Like all the previous Idolm@ster series, your enemies cheat their way so you can be sure that all of the maps will be unfair to you. Cheats like AI will ignore height damage, can't manually assign what path to take, and such. But this can be remedied by pimpimg your idols' visual, cool, and cute stats to max with equipment and then abuse burst mode during lives by pairing idols to each other while doing their dance numbers.

tldr it's shit but do it for her anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142989596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1478790193}
review: I've finished this on the vita and from what I've played so far this a very good port. Yes It's like any other tactical rpg, which isn't a bad thing in particular as the gameplay is still very fun and enjoyable. Just don't expect an amazing story but if you're a big fan fire emblem or final fantasy tactics and don't know about hdn you'll really enjoy the gameplay here. Just put it to the highest difficulty. If you're looking for another or alternative choice for a fun tactical weeb game aside Valkyria Chronicles on steam than this is still a solid option.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115393997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1499046135}

author: {'steamid': '76561198091595412', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1603449022}
review:
It's about time that Noire gets her own game!

Our lovely Noire is, just like every other character in this game, drawn in "Chibi"-style, making the characters look cute in a way we weren't used to until now.


There is, of course, a lot of fan-service included and that's what most of us want, right?
The player is actually (more or less) part of the story, even though he has no clue at all, which is not accurate if you look at the actual player, but tolerable and we forgive this fact anyway since we have even more cute girls in here!


Everyone will find here his special team of girls and master this game!

Enough chit-chat, pay some attention to Noire, she's getting angry already!

author: {'steamid': '76561198058572820', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3098, 'last_played': 1488071122}
review:
[h1]Don't tell Noire, but this is still my game. She just got a logo. 
- Neptune[/h1]

He de admitir que mientras me planteaba analizar el titulo no estaba seguro de si debÃ­a recomendarlo o no, pero ciertamente es que no puedo calificarlo como un juego no recomendable ya que confÃ­o en que si has entrado hasta esta secciÃ³n es porque conoces el universo Neptunia y ya eres fan.

Hyperdevotion Noire es un spin-off de la saga Neptunia que abandona el (francamente excelente) esquema jugable de RPG por turnos de la saga principal para pasar a un sistema jugable de RPG TÃ¡ctico, actualmente en un gran estado de forma gracias al Ã©xito de la veterana saga Fire Emblem.
En este juego cambiamos el rol de protagonista a Noire, lo cual a pesar de ser unos personajes mÃ¡s queridos de la saga por sus seguidores, termina pasÃ¡ndole factura al tÃ­tulo ya que la ausencia de Neptune como eje principal de las interacciones reduce mucho su calidad. Noire es buena coprotagonista, pero le falta algo como principal heroÃ­na.
TambiÃ©n se han visto reducidas las interacciones a travÃ©s de la cuarta pared, siendo sustituidas por una (cuestionable desde mi punto de vista) funciÃ³n del juego que emplaza al jugador como un personaje mÃ¡s del argumento a travÃ©s del "secretario" de Noire, creando una suerte de hÃ­brido entre RPG TÃ¡ctico y Date Sim. Esto, en mi opiniÃ³n, no hace sino bajarle la calidad al producto que, sumado al hecho de que ya no existe un avance de la historia mediante exploraciÃ³n, sino que es una escena introductoria a un combate y la escena posterior, unida al hecho de que se acabaron las charlas superfluas y las puyitas de colegueo, ahora todo es hablar sobre luchar, le restan atractivo al desarrollo tanto de la trama como de los personajes.

En lo puramente jugable el juego cumple bien su papel. Cada personaje tiene su estilo y se adapta mejor o peor a segÃºn quÃ© tipos de misiones, ademÃ¡s se incluye un sistema por el que las protagonistas pueden apoyarse entre ellas al usar habilidades estando juntas en formaciÃ³n, reduciendo el consumo de SP de la habilidad, aumentando su fuerza y subiendo el medidor Lily (que sustituye al Exe para los movimientos finales). El principal problema de esto Ãºltimo es lo fÃ¡cil que se convierte en un sploit, haciendo que la mayorÃ­a de misiones (sobretodo contra bosses) estÃ©n mas centradas en encajar varios Lilys por turno que en una estrategia real.
En el tema de escenarios el juego lo hace mejor que la saga principal, cada escenario de la historia es Ãºnico y con un tema caracterÃ­stico (incluso si hay varios combates dentro de la misma misiÃ³n el escenario varÃ­a) por lo que en este aspecto no se le puede echar en cara nada, aunque si hay que hacer menciÃ³n al, por momentos, algo injusto sistema enemigo, donde da igual que tipo de enemigo y trampa haya en el escenario, estos son inmunes a sus efectos, haciendo algunas fases largas y tediosas al no permitirse mÃ¡s movimiento que en "L" ([url=http://i.imgur.com/YFJfMoD.jpg]ejemplo de frustraciÃ³n mÃ¡xima[/url]).

Por Ãºltimo para no alargarme mucho, el apartado grÃ¡fico se caracteriza por un estilo chibi de los personajes y una vista cenital, no abundan los detalles pero cumple su cometido y, aunque a primera vista pueda echar para atrÃ¡s, casa con el conjunto y hace una experiencia agradable.
En cuanto a la parte "argumental" del titulo se han mejorado los modelos que se utilizaban en los tÃ­tulos anteriores y se ha aÃ±adido mÃ¡s dinamismo de movimientos durante las conversaciones, asÃ­ como unas transformaciones de las diosas mÃ¡s fluidas.


En general si te gusta el universo Neptunia te recomiendo que pruebes el tÃ­tulo, como poco aprenderÃ¡s nueva informaciÃ³n sobre los Shares, si por el contrario eres nuevo en la franquicia, mejor prueba primero la saga principal pues este tÃ­tulo tienes mÃ¡s posibilidades de echarte atrÃ¡s que de engancharte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276383313', 'num_games_owned': 2410, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 1216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1216, 'last_played': 1479143436}
review:
game is fun but one thing i don't like about this is this game lock at 30fps with 16:9 1080p ratio
if you have a wide screen monitor like mine 34inch 3440x1440,then you are out of luck.the only resolution that can scale properly is 1920x1080 without leaving the black bar.i have so much problem with this game and i constantly seen graphic lag in game.but i manage to finish the game and get norm ending.and the pathetic side is this game and all other neptunia game never get patch i mean come on ,i am rolling a gtx1080 and it sould not be an issue for graphic lagg here that occured randomly. seriously though,im runing a beast of a machine here and never once the game crash on me.......ithink that is a good thing
cause it support my xeon e1230 v5 very well.
the only thing i find it annoying in game is the dialog
it's patheticly slow on animation.....and all the HDD cpu voices stays normal like when they are human form which is i don't like.purple heart,black heart must sound mature but not in this game.
the pros are the chibi character is well design and i never once change any weapon and still using the ol dlc one.the dlc is pricier than the game but it is optional and the last boss is a pushover.
anyway if you like srpg,you can get disgaea PC.rather than this.although i can say this is the shortest game of the series if you don't plan to grind through sub quest.
but if you do want to get true ending then you have long way to grind and raise lily rank to 70 with each character which is to boring to be honest.
i would recommend this game if your are fan on the series even if a spin off.....it is quite decent for the price and challenging at the end of the chapter.

review:

Positive:
- cute Chars

review:
Hyperdevotion Noire: Goddess Black Heart non Ã¨ il capolavoro del genere e tanto meno vuole esserlo. Tuttavia Ã¨ un tattico piÃ¹ che discreto, veloce e dinamico, particolarmente indicato per i neofiti o per i veterani che vogliono distendere i nervi con un titolo semplice, ma allo stesso tempo accattivante. Il tutto condito con fanciulle sexy e un comparto tecnico gradevole.
Un lavoro che fa del fan service ossessivo il suo marchio di fabbrica, cosÃ¬ come i vari Neptunia, potrÃ  fare la gioia degli estimatori dei prodotti di Idea Factory.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043569804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1468020095}
review:
Two of my favorite game series, Disgaea and Hyperdimension Neptunia, combined into one gameplay style? The potential of this game was easily off the charts gameplay-wise, but...
Honestly, I'd give this a neutral review if I could. It isn't that it's bad but... the combination of these two gameplay mechanics are surprisingly subpar, both of these combined somehow managed to not be equal to each game individually.
Now that doesn't mean I hate the game as a whole, but... there's one thing included in this game that irritates me to my core; the player. Our self-inserted character without a voice... I get that this is pretty much fan-service, but I personally despise lackluster personality-less self-inserts with a passion, not to mention that the player is constantly tagging along in their adventures even when he was given a job specifically to work at Lastation Basillicom as a secretary. A secretary is not an adventurer, but it seems no-one paid attention to this small enormous detail.
I'm sorry, but there must always be one rotton apple in the bushel.
